monogr.title: The rebellion : a tragedy: as it was acted nine dayes together, and divers times since with good applause, by his Majesties Company of Revells. Written by Thomas Rawlins
monogr.author: Rawlins, Thomas

div.head: To the Worshipfull, and his honorred Kinsman, Robert Ducie, of Aston, in the County of Stafford Esquire: Son to Sir Robert Ducie, Knight and Baronet Deceased.
div.p: NOt to boast of any perfections, I have never yet bin Owner of Ingratitude, and would bee loath Envy should taxe mee now; having at this time opportunity to pay part of that debt I owe your love. This Tragedy had at the presentment a generall Applause; yet I have not that want of modesty, as to conclude it wholly worthy your Patronage; although I have bin bold to fixe your name unto it. Yet however, your Charity will be famous in protecting this Plant, from the breath of Zoilus; and forgiving this my confidence: and your acceptance cherish a study of a more deserving Peece, to quit the remainder of the ingagement: In

closer.signed: Your Kinsman ready to serve you▪ Thomas Rawlins.
